column4: on my other computer, my eth0 card isnt working, does anybody know how to configure it?
dapper
not without more information.  try ifconfig -a on the box, see if it shows up in the list
ifconfig -a command not found
try  /sbin/ifconfig -a
sounds like networking isn't installed
which would explain why the card doesn't show up.  although I'm curious about how you would know it doesn't show up if ifconfig isn't available

im in gnome, and in the (sry, win...s term:) system tray in the upper right toolbar thing it has a networking monitor and it has a red x over it, and when i double click it, it tries to configure a ppp connection, and doesnt have an eth0 connection
oh, and firefox doesnt do anything, not even my router
that's odd, I'm not sure how you got there.  but if ifconfig doesn't exist on the machine, something went wrong with the installation.
of course not, it has nowhere to send things to
double check,  do:   find / -name ifconfig         make sure it doesn't exist anywhere on the box
i t couldnt access a lot of directories, so im now sudo and did it, and it taking a long time
it's normal for that to take several minutes,
it's a slow check but also a definitive one

Warning, hard link count is wrong for /proc: this may be a bug in your filesystem driver. automatically turning on find's -noleaf option. earlier results may have failed to include directories that should have been searched
you can ignore that, /proc is a pseudo file system
k, no results
any ideas?
if it's a new installation, I would repeat the installation, as something is very wrong
ive had this install for awhile, but i wouldnt mind reinstalling it.  ill get to it, thanks a million!
the mount point must exist.  it's just a directory, create it with mkdir
